intro: Machaeranthera scoparia, commonly known as the prairie blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small yellow daisies. The plant typically grows in prairie and open woodland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its showy, yellow flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is also valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local ecosystems.
